title: Michael Milne
text:
Michael Milne (born 5 February 1999) is an Irish <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player who has come through the <a href="Leinster%20Rugby">Leinster Rugby</a> academy and became a member of the Senior Squad on 15 April 2021. He plays as a <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Prop">prop</a>.
Early life.
Milne was born and raised in <a href="Birr%2C%20County%20Offaly">Birr, County Offaly</a> and first began playing rugby aged five or six for <a href="Birr%20RFC">Birr RFC</a>. He attended <a href="Cistercian%20College%2C%20Roscrea">Cistercian College</a> and helped the school to their first ever <a href="Leinster%20Schools%20Rugby%20Senior%20Cup">Leinster Schools Rugby Senior Cup</a> in 2015.
Leinster.
Milne made his senior competitive debut for Leinster in their opening fixture of the <a href="2019%E2%80%9320%20Pro14">2019–20 Pro14</a> season away to Italian side <a href="Benetton%20Rugby">Benetton</a> on 28 September 2019, which the province won 32–27.
Ireland.
Milne was part of the <a href="Ireland%20national%20under-20%20rugby%20union%20team">Ireland under-20s</a> squad that won a <a href="Grand%20Slam%20%28rugby%20union%29">grand slam</a> during the <a href="2019%20Six%20Nations%20Under%2020s%20Championship">2019 Six Nations Under 20s Championship</a>.
